name: Hampton Inn Norfolk Naval Base

reviews.text: This Hampton Inn was friendly clean and lived up to its wonderful name. The room was very clean also the bed was very comfortable. Unlike other hotels that have few stations to watch we was well entertained the entire night by movies on the stations they provided . Rooms was a nice size with a sitting chair with foot rest also a desk for free internet which works great. This is enough space for a total of 4. They also provide you with lots of personal items and towels. If your looking for a great place thats pieceful,clean this is the place. They also provide you with a free hot breakfast yummy.
reviews.title: Awesome Place!

reviews.text: This hotel was amazing in so many ways. After cancelling my reservation in Hampton (due to bed bugs-ugh!), I ended up in Norfolk at this hotel. My colleagues and I were pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. Everyone said hello, from the front desk staff to housekeeping. Our rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. There were so many freebies including breakfast, water bottles, a newspaper, and a take away breakfast if you didn't have time.
reviews.title: Loved This Place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were only two things I would've changed. The gym equipment is pretty old and there were only three machines (one elliptical, one treadmill, and one bike), but it was sufficient. Also, there is a train and naval base nearby. The train was loud, but I never heard it after midnight. Sometimes the planes flying by woke me up. But honestly, these were minor things compared to how great this place was. I definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Great Stay! Great Staff! VERY Clean ROOM!

reviews.text: I am always a little leary about hotels before I book, ESPECIALLY if they are under 4-stars. However- this hotel had gotten such good reviews and the pictures on the site were tempting so I booked for the Labor Day weekend and used my govt ID- knocked my rate down to $80/night. (Much better than any of the other hotels near/on VA Beach as that was why I booked this trip.)
reviews.title: A PLUS!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Instead of a long write-up, I'll just give you reasons why I would definitely stay at this hotel again:
reviews.title: Home away from home....

reviews.text: As in, right next door practically! This is an older HI, but well maintained, operated, and staffed. Rooms are typical HI, clean, nice bathrooms, free internet, good choice of TV channels. Hotel is surrounded by fast food outlets -- you'll have to go a bit further afield if you're looking for a more upscale restaurant. Nice staff.
reviews.title: Convenient to the Norfolk Naval Base

reviews.text: This is an average place to stay, but is overpriced. Even with the AAA discount it is not worth the money you pay. If this was a $79 room I would have given it the best rating, but because of the price paid - I was very disappointed.
reviews.title: Overpriced, but convenient

reviews.text: Pros: - the staff have all been wonderful, friendly and helpful. The bathroom was clean (except for a few spots in the shower); the bed sheets were clean.
reviews.title: Older Hampton, very basic, friendly staff

reviews.text: Cons: the rugs and furniture are a bit outdated but appeared fairy clean.
reviews.title: Friendly staff doing a great job right by the base

reviews.text: I am traveling with a teenage daughter and I felt safe, the location looks a bit intimidating but I think that’s the Naval Base feel. We were close to the college & Ruby Tuesdays.
reviews.title: Convenient to ODU. Clean and reliable.

reviews.text: This Hampton Inn's service is phenomenal! Staff was incredibly friendly, helpful and accommodating. High-five to Helen and Dominic! Unfortunately, the hotel itself is in desperate need of renovation. Though it appears that public areas have been upgraded, the rooms leave much to be desired. Upon walking into the room, I was greeted with the pungent smell of mildew. The room seemed stale and without proper ventilation. The mattresses were lumpy and in need of replacement, and the bedding held a faint odor as well. Sadly, the hotel windows didn't open. Lighting was poor, making it very difficult to utilize the work desk for much more than a luggage stand. The carpet was sprinkled with stains and had an overall darkened color, like it was weighted down with ground-in dirt. Thankfully, the bathroom was roomy and well lit, with plenty of bath linen. It was the most pleasant area in the room. Though my stay was bearable , I would not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: A Disappointing Hilton Brand

reviews.text: Good Staff, Hotel is older but well maintained, pool and hot tub. Walking distance to several fast food restaurants and a ruby tuesday. Location is a plus if you are doing business in the Norfolk Naval Base.
reviews.title: Older Hotel, Good location to the Navy Base.

reviews.text: After a stay from HELL at another hotel...I checked in after telling the clerk of my nightmare she matched the rate I was paying with approval from her manager of course...My room was very clean..breakfast was great every morning. I felt like they went out of there way to make my extended stay as close to home as possible.
reviews.title: Great place for the money!

reviews.text: Woke up and went downstairs for breakfast- noticed a familiar looking car go past the window on a tow truck- it was mine!! Front desk said my car alarm was going off all night bothering people. They didn't know whose car it was and tried a few rooms to try to find out whose it was but gave up.
reviews.title: Car fiasco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not unreasonable and I understand why they would have it towed- if they hadn't taken my car info when I checked in! They even needed my license plate number! Why do they take this info if I am going to find out about an issue with my car by seeing it riding off on a tow truck. Morons.
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.text: I will start out by saying that I will probably stay here again. My boss likes their rates. I have stayed here several times over the past few weeks. One time the a/c pan overfilled and got my laptop case and luggage wet as it made the floor wet. They gave me a free night for that. Sounds fair. When there for my free night I was sitting in the lobby at around 1am when a man with a gun was walking around. turns out it was the police. They told the night auditor to come inside. So he did!!! I went back to my room to see 4 police cars and 6 officers going through the parking lot looking for someone!!! Not very safe!!!! The service is amazing though!!!!
reviews.title: Great Service...But bring a gun!!!
A Reliable, Clean, Compact, Hampton Inn
reviews.text: Slightly worn, but clean, terrific indoor great pool area, polite, responsive, well trained staff always sounded prediposed to help.
Cons: Challenging location, little if any decent food nearby, no free weights in fitness center, limited breakfast for a Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Not like they make it sound.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived to check in was confronted by homeless person looking for some money he then went inside got some coffee and set down in lobby, construction going on right next to hotel very noisey, tiolet ran off and on during the night got up in morning and water on bathroom floor from running, and the worst part, no mention of the train tracks 50 yards from the back of motel they went by 2 times during the night blowing their horns like the we coming thru the hotel, if u want to stay close to the naval base this may work but if you want to sleep find something eles.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: Check-in was prompt (probably owing to the fact we rolled in just after midnight). Room was nothing extraordinary but clean. Note that you have to pay extra for a room with a fridge and/or microwave. This property was close to Old Dominion and the athletic facilities were a quick trip down Hampton Blvd and a left onto 49th Street.
reviews.title: Great Place and staff

aka: Hampton Inn Norfolk Naval Base Hotel
description: The Hampton Inn is the perfect place to stay if looking for hotels in Norfolk, VA near the Naval Base. Our hotel is conveniently located to one of the largest Naval ports in the world and is minutes from Old Dominion University, the USS Wisconsin, Nauticus Maritime Museum, and Chrysler Museum. Enjoy free hot breakfast with Hampton's signature waffles and oatmeal every morning plus free wireless internet to keep you connected. Our guest and accessible rooms have the comforts of home with the clean and fresh Hampton bed in 1 king or 2 doubles. As always, your stay with us is backed by the 100% Hampton guarantee.
